long_description: Even though it may be simple to use, the practical value of a GPS unit ultimately depends on skills and knowledge. Authors: Bob Burns and Mike Burns. Softcover; 158 pages; black-and-white illustrations and photographs. The Mountaineers Books; copyright 2013. Learn how to obtain a trustworthy GPS position fix, determine distances and direction from your current position to your intended destination and save waypoints. Offers advice on selecting a GPS, getting started and practicing common scenarios, route finding in wilderness, using GPS with map and compass and maximizing the battery. Explore how to overcome the problems and limitations of GPS technology, as well as using a GPS device with your computer, tablet or smartphone.
short_description: Even though it may be simple to use, the practical value of a GPS unit ultimately depends on skills and knowledge. Wilderness GPS helps you to get the most out of navigating with your GPS.
